meanings.definition: A person who owns or manages a pub.
meanings.sent1: The publicans greeted customers with a warm smile at the pub.
meanings.sent2: The publicans worked hard to keep the pub clean and welcoming.
meanings.sent3: The publicans at the pub told jokes to make the customers laugh.
meanings.sent4: The publicans were the heart and soul of the neighborhood pub.
meanings.sent5: The publicans knew all the regulars by name and their favorite drinks.

meanings.definition: A tax collector in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent1: The publicans collected taxes from the citizens in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent2: The publicans were responsible for ensuring tax payments were made on time.
meanings.sent3: The publicans in Rome kept track of who owed what with great precision.
meanings.sent4: The publicans were feared by many for their role in tax collection.
meanings.sent5: The publicans in ancient Rome were known for their meticulous record-keeping.

meanings.definition: Members of a political party in the United States.
meanings.sent1: The publicans campaigned tirelessly for their political party.
meanings.sent2: The publicans attended party meetings to discuss important issues.
meanings.sent3: The publicans celebrated their party's victory with a big parade.
meanings.sent4: The publicans were proud to represent their political party in the election.
meanings.sent5: The publicans worked together to promote their party's platform to voters.
